required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of WVT078 in Patients With Multiple Myeloma (MM)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Open-label, Multicenter, Study of WVT078 in Subjects With Relapsed and/or Refractory Multiple Myeloma

brief_summary.textblock: The design of a phase I, open-label, dose finding study was chosen in order to establish a safe and tolerated dose of single agent WVT078 in patients relapses and/or refractory Multiple Myeloma (MM)

detailed_description.textblock: This first-in-human trial with WVT078 is a dose escalation study whose primary purpose is to characterize the safety, tolerability, and determine recommended dose regimen(s) of WVT078 in subjects with MM who have received two or more standard of care lines of therapy including an IMID, a proteasome inhibitor, and an anti-CD38 agent (if available) and are relapsed and/or refractory to or intolerant of each regimen. In addition, this study will assess preliminary anti-MM response of and characterize the pharmacokinetics and immunogenicity of WVT078. The results of this study will inform the future development of WVT078 as a treatment for relapsed and/or refractory MM.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of dose limiting toxicity (DLTs) in Cycle 1
primary_outcome.description: To characterize the safety, tolerability, and determine the recommended dose regimen(s) of WVT078 in subjects with relapsed and/or refractory MM
To characterize the safety, tolerability, and determine the recommended dose regimen(s) of WVT078 in subjects with relapsed and/or refractory MM
To characterize the safety, tolerability, and determine the recommended dose regimen(s) of WVT078 in subjects with relapsed and/or refractory MM
To characterize the safety, tolerability, and determine the recommended dose regimen(s) of WVT078 in subjects with relapsed and/or refractory MM

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence and severity of AEs and SAEs, including changes in laboratory values, vital signs, ECGs, and CRS/immune-mediated reactions
primary_outcome.description: To characterize the safety, tolerability, and determine the recommended dose regimen(s) of WVT078 in subjects with relapsed and/or refractory MM

secondary_outcome.description: Response assessment per International Myeloma Working Group (IMWG) criteria
Response assessment per International Myeloma Working Group (IMWG) criteria
Response assessment per International Myeloma Working Group (IMWG) criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC of WVT078 derived from plasma concentrations
Cmax of WVT078 derived from plasma concentrations
Cmin of WVT078 derived from plasma concentrations
Tmax of WVT078 derived from plasma concentrations
T1/2 of WVT078 derived from plasma concentrations
Concentration of WVT078 Anti Drug Antibodies (ADA) as measured in plasma

arm_group.description: Dose escalation study to determine Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD)/ Recommended Dose (RD) in adult patients with relapsed and/or refractory Multiple Myeloma (MM)

intervention.description: WVT078 will be administered IV (intravenously) in a dose escalation schedule

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who are relapsed and/or refractory to two or more regimens including an IMID, proteasome inhibitor, and an anti-CD38 agent (if available)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of systemic chronic steroid therapy (>or= 10mg/day prednisone or equivalent) or any immunosuppressive therapy within 7 days of first dose of study treatment
- Malignant disease other than being treated on this study
- Active known or suspected autoimmune disease
- Impaired cardiac function or clinically significant cardiac disease
- Treatment with cytotoxic or small molecule antineoplastics or any experimental therapy within 14 days or 5 half-lives whichever is shorter
- Active central nervous system involvement by malignancy or presence of symptomatic CNS metasteses
